Package gov.sandia.geotess

Class GeoTessUtils

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.VectorUnit
gov.sandia.geotess.GeoTessUtils
public class GeoTessUtils
extends gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.vector.VectorUnit
Collection of static functions to manipulate geographic information.

There is no public constructor because all methods are static. Methods can be called like "GeoTessUtils.getVector(lat, lon)"

Author:
Sandy Ballard

  • Field Details

    • approximateLatitudes

      public static boolean approximateLatitudes
      If true, then an approximate algorithm will be used to convert back and forth between geocentric and geographic latitudes. The approximation incurs an error of about 0.1 meters in latitude calculations but is much faster than the correct calculation.

      Note that the existence of this static, mutable variable technically violates thread-safety of this class. But given the assumption that the approximation is just as good as the true conversions, this is not a significant violation.

    • NL

      public static java.lang.String NL
      End-of-line character(s). Value depends on operating system.

  • Method Details

    • getOS

      public static GeoTessUtils.OSType getOS()
      Return the operating system on which GeoTess is currently running:
      • OS.WINDOWS
      • OS.MAC
      • OS.UNIX (includes all flavors of solaris and sunos)
      • OS.LINUX
      • OS.UNRECOGNIZED

      Here is a pretty comprehensive list of possible os.name values: http://lopica.sourceforge.net/os.html

      Returns:
      current operating system

    • readString

      public static java.lang.String readString​(java.io.DataInputStream input, int maxLength) throws java.io.IOException
      Read a String from a binary file. First, read the length of the String (number of characters), then read that number of characters into the String. Fails if the number of characters is > maxLength
      Parameters:
      input - DataInputStream
      Returns:
      String
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • writeString

      public static void writeString​(java.io.DataOutputStream output, java.lang.String s) throws java.io.IOException
      Write a String to a binary file. First write the length of the String (int number of characters) then write that many characters.
      Parameters:
      output - DataOutputStream
      s - String
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • writeString

      public static void writeString​(java.io.DataOutputStream output, java.lang.String[] strings) throws java.io.IOException
      Write an array of strings to a binary file. The Strings are first concatenated together with ';' as a separator. Then the combined String is written to the file using method 'writeString()' described above.
      Parameters:
      output - DataOutputStream
      strings - String[]
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • getEdgeLength

      public static double getEdgeLength​(int level)
      Return the approximate edge length in degrees for triangles on the specified tessellation level. Assumes that first level is icosahedron with triangle edgelengths of approximately 64 degrees.
      Parameters:
      level -
      Returns:
      the approximate edge length in degrees for triangles on the specified tessellation level.

    • getTessLevel

      public static int getTessLevel​(double edgeLength)
      Convert edgeLength in degrees to tessellation level. Returns round(log_2(64./edgeLength)
      Parameters:
      edgeLength -
      Returns:
      round(log_2(64./edgeLength)

      lon - the geographic longitude, in radians.
      Returns:

    • getVectorDegrees

      public static void getVectorDegrees​(double lat, double lon, double[] v)
      Get a unit vector corresponding to a point on the Earth with the specified latitude and longitude.
      Parameters:
      lat - the geographic latitude, in degrees.
      lon - the geographic longitude, in degrees.
      v - the 3-element array into which the unit vector will be copied.
